Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus was initially reported as a nosocomial pathogen in human hospitals and frequently causes abscesses, bloodstream infections, post-surgical infections, and sometimes deaths.
12
Yersinia enterocolitica as a worldwide pathogen is an important cause of food and water-borne gastrointestinal infections.
13 Nowadays, essential oils have demonstrated strong synergistic effects when used in combination with artificial and less effective preservatives.
14 Therefore, the objective of this study was to evaluate the effects of the essential oils individually and combined with sodium benzoate against methicillin-resistant S. aureus and Y. enterocolitica.
